reviewText: I really enjoy this because it focuses on pulling the abs in to get worked (which I have tendancy to forget and push out slightly).  I like it.

reviewText: Hip hugger abs is wonderful. And I'm a huge fan of Lotte Berk Method. Suzanne Cook is an easy to follow instructor and if you listen to her cues and get the form down, you WILL feel the results of these exercises. It's definitely a wonderful supplement to an existing cardio routine, or even by itself, every day or every other day. The great part is the alternate levels for all of the moves, based on your needs, to get the most challenge for your ability. I highly recommend Lotte Berk. While I've heard commentary that it's not a difficult enough workout, if done properly, has even better results than you'd ever expect. Even more cool, is the fact that ALL of their routines can be done barefoot, with no equipment, in a minimum of time. Awesome video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The only advice I can give: concentration.  If you concentrate on truly holding your abs in, your breathing, and your form, this DVD is truly amazing.  If not, if you simply go through the motions, it's no better than any other one out there.That being said, this DVD truly gives you something to work towards.  While none of them have the scary 6 pack abs found on female body builders, they all have shapes to be envious of, and Barbara? The woman held the plank pose the entire time! I was shaking the first time I did it after 30 seconds.  If you want the streamlined dancer's look, and the sleek, hard abs of someone with core strength, this is for you.  The extra blast at the end is not for the easily intimidated--it's much harder than it looks.  Great value for the money!

reviewText: The Lotte Berk Method is a form of exercise developed by Russian dancer Lotte Berk and brought to America by Lydia Bach. Drawing from dance and other similar disciplines, many of the exercises require the use of a ballet barre, and the focus is on making small, precise movements to facilitate the development of long, lean muscles. Unlike the other videos in this series, however, the movements in Hip Hugger Abs, which work the abdominal area, are performed entirely on the floor without the use of a barre.Like all of the Lotte Berk videos, this workout begins with high knee lifts to warm up. Instructor Suzanne Cook leads two other Lotte Berk instructors, one of whom shows modifications.  Also included in the warm up are push-ups: 2 sets of 10 on your knees, and then 2 sets of 10 "reverse" push-ups, performed with your hands behind you and your chest up to switch the work to the triceps. After the warm up, the workout moves to the floor.  Starting in a seated position with your knees bent, you lean back, tilting your pelvis, pulling in your abdominals, and holding a sort of isometric contraction.  You perform several repetitions and also several variations, such as holding one leg in the air.  By the end of this segment, I could definitely feel my abs working!Next comes a series of Pilates inspired movements.  Beginning on your back, you lift your bent legs in the air and dip your toes to the ground; you then perform the same movement with straight legs.  Moving on to your side, you do a single set of side leg lifts, and to finish, it's on to your stomach for a few brief holds of elbow plank.  Although all of the above are effective movements, I don't think that enough time was devoted to the individual exercises, and I didn't feel very worked out after this segment.  The workout ends as all the LBM videos do with a "Shape by Stretch" section in which you perform several different stretches to finish at a total of 26 1/2 minutes.  While there are certainly some merits to this video, better abs and Pilates workouts are available.
summary: Small, isolated movements target the abdominal area

reviewText: Based on the reviews on this board, I bought this DVD.  The main thing I read on this board was, "you must concentrate on the moves, etc., etc."So I did.  I really, REALLY focused.  I felt nothing. I was if I hadn't really worked out at all.  I tried this DVD for two weeks and did not get a single thing out of it.  I don't think I did anything wrong, I just did not get a workout from this DVD. :-(
summary: Way, waaay too easy. But why?

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoy working out with this DVD. There are three "actors" who demonstrate different levels of each exercise and the verbal cues are extremely clear. You do not need any equipment for this workout but you must pay attention and do as the instructor says. These are small, precise moves, and it is important to do them correctly in order for them to be effective. Definitely recommend this as part of an overall exercise program.

reviewText: After doing this workout a few times, I would like to edit my review. I don't think this workout is intense enough to really work the abs. I could "feel the burn" somewhat while was I doing the exercises but I didn't feel anything afterward (but I do after some of the other DVD's in this set). Some of the moves were too easy even for a beginner like me. I would recommend following Barbara (the most advanced exerciser) to see if you get more of a workout. Suzanne is an OK instructor but moves a little too fast through some of the stretches. I can't change my star rating but I would only give it 3 stars.

reviewText: I had to come back and edit my review.  Now I would probably give it 4 stars.  At first I did not like this DVD, but after doing it several times I changed my mind.  Its not a very difficult DVD, but if you really sqeeze your abs and go slow, you can feel it (and eventually see it) working.  It's still not my favorite DVD, but I would recommend the other Lotte Berk DVDs.  High Round Assets and Muscle Eats Fat were both better and I have seen results from both.

There's too much explanation.  Great for the first fews times, annoying when you've watched it a few times.

reviewText: Three instructors guide you through an intermediate workout complete with modifications for three levels of fitness. Beginners and intermediate exercisers will enjoy this the most and advanced students may feel like they are taking too many breaks between repetitions. This is because the workout is set up in two segments. The first section is simply the "method" or training session.The real workout begins when you look under the "special features." This is the workout at a speed where you will burn calories and workout at an intermediate to advanced level. So, this is truly for all fitness levels after the first workout.The exercises are based very simply on Pilates and Yoga and you will enjoy this the most if you are intermediate in both. Push ups are normal, but it is the challenging plank where your arm strength will be tested.The stretching session at the end isn't quite long enough so you might want to follow this with a yoga practice that focuses on stretching and relaxing. The exercises are all very structured and you can feel these exercises mostly in the abdominal/hip area with some exercises focusing on the arms and legs along with the abs. Unlike most strict Pilates routines, you won't be doing an extended side series and the Yoga postures are uncomplicated.If you are intermediate, you may want to walk or bike for over 30 minutes before starting this routine. I felt like I burned more calories when I was already warmed up and this workout then presented more of a challenge.The reason I think this is intermediate is because of the strength I know it takes to get to the exercises they expect you to complete. The plank is held for quite some time and the roll ups take quite a lot of time to master. This is a little beyond beginner, but you can work your way into intermediate over time.~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was my first Lotte Berk DVD, and I have to say I was impressed.  The instructor is extremely soothing, motivating and wonderful at walking you through the moves.  She does the intermediate moves, while on person does advanced moves and the third instructor shows the beginner modifications.Although several of the exercises are basic crunches and sit-ups, this was still a great DVD.  They take equally time to work your muscles and stretch them, and I certainly felt the burn and my muscles contracted in agreement.  I did feel it in more then my abs, it certainly helps your arms and "seat" as well.I haven't been doing this long enough to know that it truly will give me "hip hugger abs", but the DVD is motivating and  mellow enough that I will try often enough to see if it will give me the results we all strive for.I did the main 20-minute session and have yet to try the 10-minute bonus-blast session.  I did a quick review of it on fast-forward and it looks to be a great workout as well, with moves that look a bit more strenuous then those in the main session.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love, love, love this one and I really enjoyed this instructor, Suzanne. She was firm but sweet, lol. She gently chided you if she suspected you were getting sloppy: "Keep the integrity of your form, because they're not sloppy."Uhm, this ab work leaves Burr Leonard (The Bar Method) in the dust. I've never seen some of the exercises and my abs let me know it right away. These are incredible. Some are just plain freaking scary ... *cry* but I loved every minute of it. If you buy the 4-pack, this one alone is worth the price of the pack. I do this one every day after whatever workout I do in the pack. I alternate Lotte Berk with Bar Method but I make sure either this workout or the HHA Bonus Blast is done every day and I have people in my office coming over to touch my abs. They are ROCK HARD. It's that wonderful. There are 3 modifications shown for the workouts here and each one could be done by us, depending upon how strong we're feeling or crampy or ambitious we are.Barbara (the most advanced instructor) is really scary in this one. She kept the plank held even through the rests and she never trembled once. Perfect form, perfect posture, strong and muscular body.I'll say the easiest exercise was the Lotte style situps and that's saying something.The Bonus Blast is going to be humbling if you're not extremely fit. Be warned. It is grit tough and maddeningly horrifying, lol. At first, you just collapse and stare at her as if she's some kind of demon woman. But somehow, you force yourself back up into position and pick it up and keep going. Your legs won't be as high as hers, your back won't be as straight but each time you do it, your form will improve to the point at which you smile happily when you realize, "OMG, I'm DOING IT!"The Bonus Blast is only about 10 minutes, but you're working hard the entire time. Again, there is no easing in, especially on the Bonus Blasts. You get straight to business and isn't that what you want when you don't have a lot of time for chatter in DVDs?I love these kinds of exercises and am happy that I bought the 4-pack because there are 4 DVDs -- I have a very nice rotation now and am even more motivated now to keep pushing forward! Hooray!One other thing: If you've been doing The Bar Method or Callanetics, you will be very well prepared for the Lotte Berk  workouts. If you don't have that background, don't worry. There is a beginner DVD/tape. If you start with this one, you just may collapse from the shaking, trembling and sweating. LOL! And strangely you'll feel really good about it because every muscle in your body will feel worked and you'll also be strangely relaxed.The abs are notoriously difficult to sculpt and they resist overtraining but if you're watching your diet and you are religious with your workouts, you will see them begin to appear. You really will. This is the first DVD I've used that has backed up that boast.
summary: NO hype - get ready for true Hip Hugger Abs!
